info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 7 at 10:55PM EDT until September 8 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Melbourne FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Orange and Osceola.
* WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1055 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Orlando, Kissimmee, Bay Lake, Buena Ventura Lakes, Orlando International Airport, East Lake Toho, Narcoossee, Oak Ridge, Celebration, Four Corners, Belle Isle, Yeehaw Junction, Austin Tindall Park, Osceola Heritage Park, Hunters Creek, Lake Nona, Pine Castle, Lake Hart, Sea World and Campbell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT MONDAY
